application.name: phocube
application.brief: Creates phase, incidence, and/or emission angle bands for a cube
application.description: This program creates a cube where the bands represent different photogrametric values such as phase angle, emission angle, incidience angle, albedo, and other values specific to the instrument that acquired the image.

liens.item: Convert to a IsisProcessBySpectra when it gets written

history.change: Original version
Converted to Isis 3.0, and made it create a cube rather than adding backplanes.
Modified filename parameters to be cube parameters where necessary
Fixed problem where the program through an error when it tried to propagate the pixel type from the input file.
Added the bandbin group to the cube labels.
Fixed a bug with switched samples and lines
Moved into Photometry and Radiometry category
Modified to use ProcessByBrick instead of ProcessByLine to make faster
Documentation fixes
Removed references to CubeInfo
Added new parameters: PIXELRESOLUTION, LINERESOLUTION, SAMPLERESOLUTION, DETECTORRESOLUTION, NORTHAZIMUTH, SUNAZIMUTH, SPACECRAFTAZIMUTH, OFFNADIRANGLE
Fixed a bug that occurred when processing band-dependant cubes
Added the propagation of the input cube labels, objects, blobs, etc..., so the pedigree of the input source is retained.
Set the defaults for PIXELRESOLUTION, LINERESOLUTION, SAMPLERESOLUTION, DETECTORRESOLUTION, NORTHAZIMUTH, SUNAZIMUTH, SPACECRAFTAZIMUTH, OFFNADIRANGLE to FALSE
Added parameters/bands SUBSPACECRAFTGROUNDAZIMUTH and SUBSOLARGROUNDAZIMUTH.
Added parameters LOCALINCIDENCE and LOCALEMISSION.

Added the option to propagate the input pixel value (DN) as the first plane (however, this, by default, will not be invoked as default so as to preserve preexisting behavior). Ensure the Center, OriginalBand, Name, and Width BandBin keyword values are populated properly and propagated to the output label (should support camera models). Added MORPHOLOGY and ALBEDO backplane options for special mosaic options.
Reviewed and added documentation with Tammy Becker and Paul Giessler.
Fixed a bug where the Detector Resolution was not being reported correctly in the output cube. The reported value was completly incorrect.
Fixed an out of array bounds problem that caused unpredictable behavior.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the input filename.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This file will contain the phase and/or emission and/or incidence angles.

parameter.name: DN
parameter.brief: Propagate the input pixel to the output file.
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then the input pixel value will be propagated to the output file. This will help alleviate potential additional runs of cubeit when necessary. When this option is selected, the BandBin values are retained for this band so that geometry operations are preserved.

parameter.name: PHASE
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a phase angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values in units of degrees.

parameter.name: EMISSION
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then an emission angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. The emission anlgle is calculated using the surface normal for the elipsoid. (See the LOCALEMISSION parameter also)

parameter.name: INCIDENCE
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then an incidence angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. The incidence anlgle is calculated using the surface normal for the elipsoid. (See the LOCALINCIDENCE parameter also)

parameter.name: LOCALEMISSION
parameter.brief: Create a local emission angle band.
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a local emission angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. The local emission angle will be calculated using the normal to the local slope as defined by the shape model used in the camera. If the shape model is using the ellipsoid the LOCALEMISSION angle will be the same as the EMISSION angle.

parameter.name: LOCALINCIDENCE
parameter.brief: Create a local incidience angle band.
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a local incidence angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. The local incidence angle will be calculated using the normal to the local slope as defined by the shape model used in the camera. If the shape model is using the ellipsoid the LOCALINCIDENCE angle will be the same as the INCIDENCE angle.

parameter.name: LATITUDE
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a latitude band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: LONGITUDE
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a longitude band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: PIXELRESOLUTION
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a pixel resolution band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of meters.

parameter.name: LINERESOLUTION
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a line resolution band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of meters.

parameter.name: SAMPLERESOLUTION
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a sample resolution band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of meters.

parameter.name: DETECTORRESOLUTION
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a detector resolution band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of millimeter.

parameter.name: NORTHAZIMUTH
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a north azimuth band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: SUNAZIMUTH
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a sun azimuth band will be created in the ouput cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: SPACECRAFTAZIMUTH
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a spacecraft azimuth band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: OFFNADIRANGLE
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a offNadir angle band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees.

parameter.name: SUBSPACECRAFTGROUNDAZIMUTH
parameter.brief: Creata a sub spacecraft ground azimuth band.
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a subspacecraaft ground azimuth band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. This is the clockwise angle on the ground between a line drawn from the ground point to the North pole of the body and a line drawn from the ground point to the sub spacecraft point.

parameter.name: SUBSOLARGROUNDAZIMUTH
parameter.brief: Create a sub solar ground azimuth band.
parameter.description: If this parameter is true then a subsolar ground azimuth band will be created in the output cube. The pixel values will be in units of degrees. This is the clockwise angle on the ground between a line drawn from the ground point to the North pole of the body and a line drawn from the ground point to the sub solar point.

description.p: This plane is computed from the resolution and emission angle using the following formula: MORPHOLOGY = PIXELRESOLUTION/ cos(EMISSION) . The resulting backplane can then be used automos to create a morphology-based mosaic product. This option will always use the local emission angle if a DEM exists. If not, it will use the default calculation (from the ellipsoid). All values are tested for zero values and set to a constant very close to zero so all pixels should have real values.
To utilize the this backplane in automos, add the parameters priority=band type=keyword keyname=Name keyvalue=morphology criteria=lesser. See automos documentation for further details.

This plane is computed from the resolution, incidence and emission angles using the following formula: ALBEDO = PIXELRESOLUTION * [ (1 / cos(EMISSION)) + (1 / cos(INCIDENCE)) ] . The resulting backplane can then be used automos to create an albedo-based mosaic product. This option will always use the local emission and incidence angles if a DEM exists. If not, it will use the default calculation (from the ellipsoid). All values are tested for zero values and set to a constant very close to zero so all pixels should have real values.
To utilize the this backplane in automos, add the parameters priority=band type=keyword keyname=Name keyvalue=albedo criteria=lesser. See automos documentation for further details.
